com.flamingOctoIronman

Class FlamingOctoIronman

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flamingOctoIronman.FlamingOctoIronman
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class FlamingOctoIronman
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The game engine's main class. Contains the main loop and is what is first created when the game is ran. To start, create a new Thread from a new instance of this class and start it.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The main CoreEventBusService that handles all the CoreEvents

      • streamManager

        private StreamManager streamManager
        Handles all the output logging for the game. This is the one manager that should be in this class. It's here to allow for stream output before the whole engine starts up The preferred method of referencing this is through the DebuggingManager once it's been created

      • window

        private MyWindow window
        The JFrame window, is only used for testing and will be removed later

        private static DeathReason reason
        The reason the game died

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        private DeathReason startGame()
        Starts and ends the game's life
        Returns:
        A result enum based on how the game exited

      • preinit

        private void preinit()
        The pre-initialization stage of the game's life.

        In this stage:

        • The stream manager is created
        • The main log file is added to the stream manager
        • The core bus is created
        • The core manager manager is created

        Events fired:

        This method does not fire any events.

        What this method is used for

        This method is used to initialize and get a copy of the StreamManager, CoreEventBusService, and the CoreManagerManager. No managers other than the stream manager (with the exception of static methods) may be used here. No cross-module communication is allowed here.
        See Also:
        StreamManager, CoreEventBusService, com.flamingOctoIronman.core.manager.flaminoctoironman.CoreManagerManager

      • init

        private void init()
        The initialization stage of the game's life.

        In this stage:

        • CoreManagerManager#initialize(CoreEventBusService) is called
        • A new window is created by calling MyWindow.MyWindow()
          • (temporary)
        • An event is published

        Events fired:

        InitializationEvent

        What this method is used for

        This method is used to create all the managers, and register their methods with the CoreEventBusService. No cross-module communication is allowed here.
        See Also:
        com.flamingOctoIronman.core.manager.flaminoctoironman.CoreManagerManager

      • postinit

        private void postinit()
        The post-initialization stage of the game's life.

        In this stage:

        • An event is published
        • Sub-module's methods are registered with the CoreEventBus via CoreManagerManager#postInitialize(CoreEventBusService coreBus)

        Events fired:

        PostInitializationEvent

        What this method is used for

        This method is used for the final initialization of the managers and sub-managers. Cross-module interfacing is allowed here.

      • startUp

        private void startUp()
        The start-up stage of the game's life.

        In this stage:

        • An event is published

        Events fired:

        StartUpEvent

        What this method is used for

        This method is used to start any systems required by the game's overlaying framework. Game mechanics should be implemented here. Cross-module communication is allowed here.

      • gameLoop

        private void gameLoop()
        The game loop stage of the game's life.

        In this stage:

        • The main game loop is ran
        • An event is published
        • Any remaining time left in the tick is slept through to ensure a constant framerate

        Events fired:

        GameLoopEvent - Published every tick

        What this method is used for

        This method is used to fire an event on every tick in the game's life. Anything that needs to be dynamically updated should be annotated for this event. Cross-module communication is allowed here.

      • shutDown

        private void shutDown()
        The shut-down stage of the game's life.

        In this stage:

        • An event is published

        Events fired:

        ShutDownEvent

        What this method is used for

        This method is used for notifying the managers and sub-systems that the game is being shut down. Cross module communication is allowed here, but may fail due to systems shutting down.

      • exit

        private void exit()
        The exit stage of the game's life.

        In this stage:

        • The game actually ends

        Events fired:

        This method does not fire any events.

        What this method is used for

        Any core finalization that needs to run right before the game shuts down.

      • getInstance

        public static FlamingOctoIronman getInstance()
        Returns the game's instance. Creates and returns the instance if it is null.
        Returns:
        The instance of the game.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts the game and the game's thread.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments passed from the command line
        See Also:
        Thread

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the thread and calls startGame()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • stopGame

        public void stopGame(DeathReason forDying)
        Shuts the game down peacefully

        The CoreManagerManager for the game

      • getStreamManager

        public StreamManager getStreamManager()
        Returns the game's StreamManager. The preferred way of accessing this is through the DebugginManager after it has been initialized.
        Returns:
        The game's StreamManager

      • getCoreManager

        public static CoreManager getCoreManager(java.lang.String simpleName)
        Get a CoreManager based on the passed String. This method is mainly for convenience, if called before init() is called.
        Parameters:
        simpleName - The simple name of the class you want to get the instance of.
        Returns:
        The CoreManager associated with the simpleName.
